artifacts.summary: Focused analysis confirming completeness theorems are correct - BMCS completeness is Henkin-style (valid for its validity notion), FMP completeness is axiom-free, both are mathematically sound when combined with standard soundness

partial_progress.details: Analyzed validity definitions, confirmed completeness is correct for BMCS/FMP validity notions

validity_notions.name: valid
validity_notions.description: Standard task-semantic validity over ALL models

validity_notions.name: bmcs_valid
validity_notions.description: Henkin-style validity over BMCS bundles only

validity_notions.name: semantic_truth_at_v2
validity_notions.description: FMP-internal validity over finite closure-based world states

findings.relationship: valid phi ==> bmcs_valid phi (subset), bmcs_valid phi <==> |- phi (BMCS completeness), |- phi ==> valid phi (soundness)
